unittitle.value: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records

abstract.value: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 represents telecommunication workers in Westerchester and Putnam counties. The collection contains materials from the 1989 campaign and the archived website.

p.value:
To cite the archived website in this collection:
Identification of item, date; Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records; WAG 130; Wayback URL; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

http://www.cwa1103.org/ was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of The California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service in 2009 as part of Labor Unions and Organizations (U.S.) Web Archive. In 2015, the website was migrated to Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2019,  http://www.cwa1103.org/index.cfm?zone=/unionactive/past_articles.cfm&localnum=1103 was added to better capture the website. The accession number associated with this website is 2019.140.

Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 received its charter on May 12, 1961 with 900 members. By the 1990s, the union had grown to representing over 2000 New York telephone workers in Westchester and Putnam counties. Daniel Keenan was president from 1964-1979 and Robert McCracken was president from 1989-2007. As of this writing (2014) Kevin Sheil is president of the union.

The collection contains materials related to the 1989 union elections and lawsuits related to the union. It also includes the archived website for the union, which has been captured by NYU since 2009.

Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Archived Website: March 2009-ongoing

Scope and Content Note

The website contains their newsletter, the Eagle, event listings, union news, strikes, contracts, agreements, and other information on benefits. Also includes the member page for with information about union events and happenings, registration information, educational resources about worker rights, committees, and community activities.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.

Accruals

New site crawls are accrued semiannually.

Appraisal

Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of cwa1103.org and www.cwa1103.org/index.cfm?zone=/unionactive/past_articles.cfm&localnum=1103 in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.
